intro: Anisepta graveolens, commonly known as the stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. It is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the leaves are crushed. Anisepta graveolens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in humid, low-light environments.
